**Basic Syntax**
```{r}
#Creating a list of numbers
scores=c(21,23,34,54,12)
scores
mean(scores)
x=1:100
x[x>10|x<90]
```
There are many pre-installed datasets in R. 
```{r}
#Air quality data of New York City
head(airquality,9)
```
Here's how we can plot graphs based on given data:
```{r}
#Scatter plot of Ozone versus Wind
plot(airquality$Wind, airquality$Ozone,main="Ozone vs. Wind",xlab="Wind(mph)",ylab="Ozone(ppb)")
#What happens when you try to plot the whole dataset?
plot(airquality)
```
